Sentencas: Steam reforming of kerosene was investigated to produce syngas as a fuel for solid-oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Hydrogen production and coke minimization through reforming of kerosene over bi-metallic ceria-alumina supported Ru-Ni catalysts

Sentencas: Catalytic performances of synthesized hi-metallic Ru-Ni containing ceria-alumina supported catalysts were compared with mono-metallic catalysts containing only Ni or Ru, in the reforming reaction of kerosene.
Titulo: Hydrogen production and coke minimization through reforming of kerosene over bi-metallic ceria-alumina supported Ru-Ni catalysts

Sentencas: These catalysts had mesoporous structures with narrow pore size distributions.
Titulo: Hydrogen production and coke minimization through reforming of kerosene over bi-metallic ceria-alumina supported Ru-Ni catalysts

Sentencas: Performance of the catalyst containing 1% Ru and 15% Ni was the most stable with minimum coke and CH4 formation, as compared to the mono-metallic catalysts and bi-metallic catalysts containing less Ni.
Titulo: Hydrogen production and coke minimization through reforming of kerosene over bi-metallic ceria-alumina supported Ru-Ni catalysts

Sentencas: Incorporation of 1% Ru into Ni based catalysts significantly improved catalyst stability.
Titulo: Hydrogen production and coke minimization through reforming of kerosene over bi-metallic ceria-alumina supported Ru-Ni catalysts

Sentencas: All of the catalysts were very active, giving complete conversion of kerosene at 800 degrees C. Increase of H2O/C ratio in the feed stream also caused more stable operation with less CH4 and CO formation.
Titulo: Hydrogen production and coke minimization through reforming of kerosene over bi-metallic ceria-alumina supported Ru-Ni catalysts

Sentencas: Results also proved that high hydrogen yields could be obtained by steam reforming of kerosene, producing a synthesis gas which might be used as a fuel in solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Hydrogen production and coke minimization through reforming of kerosene over bi-metallic ceria-alumina supported Ru-Ni catalysts
Hydrogen production and coke minimization through reforming of kerosene over bi-metallic ceria-alumina supported Ru-Ni catalysts
Hydrogen production and coke minimization through reforming of kerosene over bi-metallic ceria-alumina supported Ru-Ni catalysts
